summary:
Tony: I'm not that dramatic. 
Stephen: when I asked you why you were wearing a bejeweled tiara, you quoted the entirety of...
body:
Tony: I’m not that dramatic.

Stephen: when I asked you why you were wearing a bejeweled tiara, you quoted the entirety of Shakespeare’s “All The Word’s a Stage” monologue from “As You Like It” and then broke down crying. And you know the scariest part? You were sober.

reblog.comment:
Tony: I’m not that dramatic.

Stephen: when I asked you why you were wearing a bejeweled tiara, you quoted the entirety of Shakespeare’s “All The Word’s a Stage” monologue from “As You Like It” and then broke down crying. And you know the scariest part? You were sober.

trail.content_raw:
Tony: I’m not that dramatic.

Stephen: when I asked you why you were wearing a bejeweled tiara, you quoted the entirety of Shakespeare’s “All The Word’s a Stage” monologue from “As You Like It” and then broke down crying. And you know the scariest part? You were sober.
trail.content:
Tony: I’m not that dramatic.

Stephen: when I asked you why you were wearing a bejeweled tiara, you quoted the entirety of Shakespeare’s “All The Word’s a Stage” monologue from “As You Like It” and then broke down crying. And you know the scariest part? You were sober.

blog.name: comradecassielang
blog.title: lesbian ally thor
blog.description: nathalie | formerly @ jewishjaybird | gay | stan loona and thor only | my most popular post is about megamind so if that's any indication of my page

summary: marvel has a huge problem with undoing every scrap of character development (mostly the larger ensemble cast films).  example...
body:
marvel has a huge problem with undoing every scrap of character development (mostly the larger ensemble cast films). 

example one: tony stark’s trilogy. tony begins his story by building his machine out of necessity. he can’t physically survive without the aid of technology. he then grows to mentally depend on this tech over the next few movies, until he’s addicted to making more and more and more. iron man is taking over his life. there’s no longer a distinction between himself and the machine. then in iron man 3, he has the arc reactor removed and throws it into the ocean. this is symbolism!!! his body is able to survive without iron man, and so is he!! he’s opening up the potential for him to grow as a person outside of his technology, to start a family, to be a good person without being a superhero. he’s learning to find his identity without being iron man. solid character arc: going from physically dependent, mentally dependent, and then learning to better himself instead of his tech. and then!!!! civil war. infinity war. spiderman homecoming. where did that characterization go?? bc its not here! again he’s indistinguishable from his machine. he doesn’t have a distinctive identity outside of iron man. his character regresses back a three movie long character arc.

example two: thor’s arc in ragnorak. best example of this is his hammer, which he for three movies believed to be the only thing that made him a hero. every time he loses it, he has a crisis because he believes himself to be nothing without it. he put all his worth in his hammer, has it destroyed permanently, and by the end of the film he has learned to find worth in himself!!! he unlocks his full power by finding it in himself!!! not his hammer!! and he finally finds his identity outside of his father’s regime (a thinly disguised metaphor for imperialism) and learns that his throne is nothing without his people. he loses his eye, and you bet your bottom dollar that’s symbolism too baby! he is taking the place of his father, who did some awful things, and he intends to be a better ruler than odin. the eyepatch symbolizes that he is finally ready to be king!!! he learns to value his people and himself, not his throne and his hammer. and then!!! infinity war immediately kills most of the population, gives him a new eye,  and gives him a new weapon to stand in for his hammer. im pissed.

final thoughts: both of these arcs show characters who formerly put all their value in their weapons finally come to realize that being a hero is not about that, it’s about you. 

infinity war  said nah it’s about how cool your powers are

by antigrav_vector

When Pepper said her friend had two boyfriends, she completely neglected to describe either of them. Tony felt it didn’t violate his promise not to hit on them if he hadn’t known who they were when he did it.

summary:
Tony: *stumbles into the room breathless* "Stephen?"
Stephen: *catches him* "Tony?what's wrong?"
Tony: "I think I'm dying doc,...
body:
Tony: *stumbles into the room breathless* “Stephen?”

Stephen: *catches him* “Tony?what’s wrong?”

Tony: “I think I’m dying doc, better start a CPR” *winks& pretends to be unconscious*

Stephen: “pulse rate ,rhythm and volume normal, breathing is good and unlaboured … You’re fine”

Tony: I can’t believe you ruined the moment.
